column3:
Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5950fc1c72c91cfdea238853065c0d4f6c8dac38 for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts
2. It does not build on either Linux i386
Seems this breaks the URI tests. I suppose we are allowing URIs, which contain no query?\n
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/446cbf5fe9384f0e49397e2bb7a9db1005476f56 for binaries and test log.\n
I don't think a query is necessary. BIP 21 is the authorative source on\nwhat URIs we should accept or reject, maybe check there.\n
@laanwj Yeah, I checked there and we don't require a query in an URI, so I removed that check and updated this pull. As you can see pull tester is fine with it now :).\n
